Class RenameForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.far.ui.model.OperationForm
      • net.pandoragames.far.ui.model.RenameForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Resetable

    public class RenameForm
extends OperationForm
    Defines the parameter for a RENAME operation.

    Olivier Wehner

      • getPatternAsRegex

        public java.util.regex.Pattern getPatternAsRegex()
                                          throws PatternException
        Returns the search pattern as a regular expression object. This includes the value of the ignoreCase flag, but not the protectExtension flag.
        Returns:
        search pattern as a regular expression object
        Throws:
        PatternException - if the pattern is invalid

      • isIgnoreCase

        public boolean isIgnoreCase()
        Returns true if the pattern string should be interpreted as being not case sensitive.
        Returns:
        true if letter case should be ignored

      • setIgnoreCase

        public void setIgnoreCase(boolean ignoreCase)
        Set to true if the pattern string should be interpreted as being not case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        ignoreCase - true if letter case should be ignored

      • getPatternString

        public java.lang.String getPatternString()
        Returns the search pattern as typed by the user.
        Returns:
        raw search pattern

      • setPatternString

        public void setPatternString(java.lang.String patternString)
        Sets the raw search pattern. This is interpreted with respect to the flags on this object.
        Parameters:
        patternString - raw search pattern

      • isPreventCaseConflict

        public boolean isPreventCaseConflict()
        Returns true if the application should not allow that two file names differ only in letter case. In Other words, the rename operation must not produce files that, when uppercased, carry equal names.
        Returns:
        true if file names must be substantially different.

      • setPreventCaseConflict

        public void setPreventCaseConflict(boolean preventCaseConflict)
        Set to true if the application should not allow that two file names differ only in letter case. In Other words, the rename operation must not produce files that, when uppercased, carry equal names.
        Parameters:
        preventCaseConflict - true if file names must be substantially different.

      • isProtectExtension

        public boolean isProtectExtension()
        Returns true if the application shall not modify the file extension. Everything after the first dot (.) should be considdered as extension.
        Returns:
        true if extension must not be modified

      • setProtectExtension

        public void setProtectExtension(boolean protectExtension)
        Set to true if the application shall not modify the file extension. Setting this to true will set the "extensionOnly" property to false. Everything after the first dot (.) should be considdered as extension.
        Parameters:
        protectExtension - true if extension must not be modified

      • isExtensionOnly

        public boolean isExtensionOnly()
        Returns true if the application shall ONLY modify the file extension but not the file name. Everything after the first dot (.) should be considdered as extension.
        Returns:
        true if only the extension must be modified

      • setExtensionOnly

        public void setExtensionOnly(boolean onlyExtension)
        Set to true if the application shall ONLY modify the file extension but not the file name. Setting this to true will set the "protectExtension" property to false. Everything after the first dot (.) should be considdered as extension.
        Parameters:
        onlyExtension - true if only the extension must be modified

      • isRegexPattern

        public boolean isRegexPattern()
        Returns true if the pattern string should be interpreted as a regular expression pattern. If false it will be interpreted as a "simple" pattern.
        Returns:
        true for regex, false for simple pattern interpretation

      • setRegexPattern

        public void setRegexPattern(boolean regexPattern)
        Set to true if the pattern string should be interpreted as a regular expression pattern. If false it will be interpreted as a "simple" pattern.
        Parameters:
        regexPattern - true for regex, false for simple pattern interpretation
